other_tests.findings: Moderate parkinsonism; motor neuron signs including gait disturbance, rigidity of the upper extremities, and muscle wasting. Fundus examination revealed PR consisting of linear and crisscrossed defects in the retinal pigment epithelium in the right eye. The left eye was normal.
CSF contained 148 white cells/mm3 (46% neutrophils, 40% lymphocytes, 14% monocytes); protein and glucose levels were normal.
Showed multiple areas of T2 hyperintensity in the cerebellum and throughout the hemispheres, some enhanced with gadolinium.
Positive for Powassan-specific IgM and a neutralizing antibody titer of 1:640.
